subtitle: Quite a rich dish - the redcurrant jelly and Madeira make a great sauce.

method.text: Preheat oven to 200°C. Prick duck skin all over with fork.
Heat oil in frying pan and cook garlic and shallots until just beginning to brown. Transfer to roasting tin.
Put duck breasts, skin-side down, into frying pan and cook until fat just begins to run. Increase heat to brown skin, then transfer to a rack over shallots in roasting tin.

Roast in oven for 10 min. Remove from oven and stir shiitake mushrooms into the shallots. Return to oven and roast for further 10 min. Transfer duck to a warm plate and leave to rest while making the sauce.

Drain off excess fat from roasting tin, and transfer roasting tin to hob. Stir in redcurrant jelly, Madeira, stock and herbs and cook over a medium heat for about 3 min. Stir in blended cornflour and bring to boil until sauce is just thickened. Season.
Slice each duck breast and fan out onto warm serving plates. Spoon over the mushroom sauce and garnish with fresh mint.

Try Game Chips  - Simply cut the potatoes into very thin slices with a sharp knife or an attachment for a food processor. Rinse in cold water. Dry on kitchen paper.
Heat the oil from the duck and fry the potato in small batches until crisp and golden brown.

title: Duck with shiitake and Madeira sauce
